docs.title: Home
docs.text: Greetings! Here is a technical writing sample for the eBird API.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: The eBird API provides access to a vast collection of bird observation data worldwide. It allows you to retrieve the latest bird sightings, search for species in specific areas, and explore historical birding records.

docs.title: 🐦 GET Recent Observations in a Region
docs.text: Retrieve the latest bird observations (from the past 30 days) for a given country, state, county, or location. The results include only the most recent sighting for each species within the specified area.

docs.title: 🔗 Endpoint
docs.text:
API Endpoint

Base URL: https://api.ebird.org Endpoint: /v2/data/obs/{regionCode}/recent Method: GET Authentication: API token required (X-eBirdApiToken)

docs.title: 🛠️ URL Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Description regionCode The country, subnational1, subnational2, or location code.

docs.title: 📌 Query Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Values Default Description back 1-30 14 Number of days back to fetch observations. cat Any available category (all) Only fetch observations from specified taxonomic categories. hotspot true, false false Fetch only observations from hotspots. includeProvisional true, false false Include unreviewed observations. maxResults 1-10000 (all) Limit the number of observations returned. r Any location code (none) Fetch observations from up to 10 locations. sppLocale Any available locale en Language for species common names.

docs.title: 💻 Example Requests
docs.text:
cURLPython (requests)JavaScript (fetch) 
curl --location 'https://api.ebird.org/v2/data/obs/KZ/recent' \
--header 'X-eBirdApiToken: {{x-ebirdapitoken}}'

import requests

url = "https://api.ebird.org/v2/data/obs/KZ/recent"
headers = {"X-eBirdApiToken": "{{x-ebirdapitoken}}"}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

fetch("https://api.ebird.org/v2/data/obs/KZ/recent", {
    method: "GET",
    headers: { "X-eBirdApiToken": "{{x-ebirdapitoken}}" }
})
.then(response => response.json())
.then(data => console.log(data));
Example Response 
[
    {
        "speciesCode": "hoocro1",
        "comName": "Hooded Crow",
        "sciName": "Corvus cornix",
        "locId": "L7884500",
        "locName": "улица Старикова, Chundzha KZ-Almaty (43.5309,79.4551)",
        "obsDt": "2020-01-21 16:35",
        "howMany": 1,
        "lat": 43.530936,
        "lng": 79.455132,
        "obsValid": true,
        "obsReviewed": false,
        "locationPrivate": true,
        "subId": "S63619695"
    }
]

docs.title: 🐦 GET Recent nearby observations
docs.text: Get the latest bird species observations from the past 30 days within a 50-kilometer radius of the provided coordinates. The results show only the most recent sighting of each species in the specified area.

docs.title: 🔗 Endpoint
docs.text:
API Endpoint

Base URL: https://api.ebird.org Endpoint: /v2/data/obs/geo/recent?lat={{lat}}&lng={{lng}} Method: GET Authentication: API token required (X-eBirdApiToken)

docs.title: 🛠️ URL Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Description lat The latitude of the central point for the observation search. lng The longitude of the central point for the observation search.

docs.title: 📌 Query Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Values Default Description back 1-30 14 The number of days back to fetch observations. cat Any available category (all) Only fetch observations from these taxonomic categories. dist 0-50 25 The search radius from the given position, in kilometers. hotspot true, false false Only fetch observations from hotspots. includeProvisional true, false false Include observations which have not yet been reviewed. lat -90 to 90 — Required. Latitude to 2 decimal places. lng -180 to 180 — Required. Longitude to 2 decimal places. maxResults 1-10,000 (all) Only fetch this number of observations. sort date, species date Sort observations by taxonomy or by date, most recent first. sppLocale Any available locale en Use this language for species common names.

docs.title: 💻 Example Requests
docs.text:
cURLPython (requests)JavaScript (fetch) 
curl --location 'https://api.ebird.org/v2/data/obs/geo/recent?lat={{lat}}&lng={{lng}}&dist={{dist}}&back={{back}}&maxResults={{maxResults}}&sort={{sort}}&hotspot={{hotspot}}&includeProvisional={{includeProvisional}}&sppLocale={{sppLocale}}' \
--header 'X-eBirdApiToken: {{x-ebirdapitoken}}'

import requests

url = "https://api.ebird.org/v2/data/obs/geo/recent"
params = {
    "lat": "{{lat}}",
    "lng": "{{lng}}",
    "dist": "{{dist}}",
    "back": "{{back}}",
    "maxResults": "{{maxResults}}",
    "sort": "{{sort}}",
    "hotspot": "{{hotspot}}",
    "includeProvisional": "{{includeProvisional}}",
    "sppLocale": "{{sppLocale}}"
}
headers = {"X-eBirdApiToken": "{{x-ebirdapitoken}}"}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, params=params)
print(response.json())

const url = new URL("https://api.ebird.org/v2/data/obs/geo/recent");
const params = {
    lat: "{{lat}}",
    lng: "{{lng}}",
    dist: "{{dist}}",
    back: "{{back}}",
    maxResults: "{{maxResults}}",
    sort: "{{sort}}",
    hotspot: "{{hotspot}}",
    includeProvisional: "{{includeProvisional}}",
    sppLocale: "{{sppLocale}}"
};

Object.keys(params).forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers: { "X-eBirdApiToken": "{{x-ebirdapitoken}}" }
})
.then(response => response.json())
.then(data => console.log(data));
Example Response 
[
    {
        "speciesCode": "domgoo1",
        "comName": "Domestic goose sp. (Domestic type)",
        "sciName": "Anser sp. (Domestic type)",
        "locId": "L99381",
        "locName": "Stewart Park",
        "obsDt": "2017-08-23 08:14",
        "howMany": 2,
        "lat": 42.4613413,
        "lng": -76.5054578,
        "obsValid": true,
        "obsReviewed": false,
        "locationPrivate": false
    }
]

docs.title: 🐦 GET View Checklist
docs.text: Fetch the details and observations associated with a specific checklist.

docs.title: 🔗 Endpoint
docs.text:
API Endpoint

Base URL: https://api.ebird.org Endpoint: /v2/product/checklist/view/{{subId}} Method: GET Authentication: API token required (X-eBirdApiToken)

docs.title: 💻 Example Requests
docs.text:
cURLPython (requests)JavaScript (fetch) 
curl --location -g 'https://api.ebird.org/v2/product/checklist/view/{{subId}}' \
--header 'X-eBirdApiToken: {{x-ebirdapitoken}}'

import requests

url = "https://api.ebird.org/v2/product/checklist/view/{{subId}}"
headers = {"X-eBirdApiToken": "{{x-ebirdapitoken}}"}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

fetch("https://api.ebird.org/v2/product/checklist/view/{{subId}}", {
    method: "GET",
    headers: { "X-eBirdApiToken": "{{x-ebirdapitoken}}" }
})
.then(response => response.json())
.then(data => console.log(data));
Example Response
